DataElement.preferredName: Anthracycline Antineoplastic Antibiotic Preparative Regimen Plan Administration Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not an anthracycline was planned as a preparative regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anthracycline Antineoplastic Antibiotic Preparative Regimen Plan Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Antineoplastic antibiotics isolated from the bacterium Streptococcus peucetius var. caesius or derived synthetically.  Anthracycline antibiotics exhibit potent cytotoxic properties due to their ability to intercalate into DNA and interact with topoisomerase II, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and repair and RNA and protein synthesis.  These agents also produce toxic free-radical intermediates and interact with cell membrane lipids, causing lipid peroxidation. (NCI04)_The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._To devise, contrive, or formed in design._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A member of a family of anticancer drugs that are also antibiotics.:The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.

Concepts.definition: An antineoplastic antibiotic that is structurally similar to the benzoquinone ansamycin antibiotic geldanamycin. A geldanamycin analogue binds to HSP90, a chaperone protein that aids in the assembly, maturation, and folding of proteins. Subsequently, the function of HSP90 is inhibited, leading to the degradation and depletion of client proteins such as kinases and transcription factors involved with cell cycle regulation and signal transduction.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

Property.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
